abort.already_configured: This source has already been configured.

data_description.country: Select your country or *Generic* if you want to setup an *ICS* source.

source.title: Select Source
source.description: Select your service provider from the list.

customize_select.title: Collection Type Customization: Select (optional)
customize_select.description: Select the collection types you want to customize in the next step.

data_description.type: You will be able to change the name/the icon/weather to use a own calendar/weather to hide in the next step.

customize.title: Collection Type Customization ({index}/{total}): {type}
customize.description: Customize {type}. You can leave all fields empty to use the default values.

data_description.alias: The new name of the collection type. (only if you want to change it)
data_description.show: Uncheck to hide the collection type.
data_description.icon: The icon of the collection type. (only if you want to change it)
data_description.picture: The path to a picture for the collection type.
data_description.use_dedicated_calendar: Check if this collection type should have its own calendar entity.
data_description.dedicated_calendar_title: The title of the dedicated calendar entity.

args.title: Configure Source
args.description: Configure your service provider. For details see the source documentation.

data_description.calendar_title: A more readable, or user-friendly, name for the waste calendar. If nothing is provided, the name returned by the source will be used.

sensor.title: Create Sensor "{sensor_number}"
sensor.description: Configure one sensor at a time.

data_description.details_format: Specifies the format used to display info in Home Assistant's more info pop-up. 'upcoming': shows a list of upcoming collections, 'appointment_types': shows a list of waste types and their next collection date, 'generic': provides all attributes as generic Python data types, 'hidden': hide attributes of upcoming collections
data_description.count: Limits Home Assistant's more info popup to displaying the next int collections
data_description.leadtime: Limits Home Assistant's more info popup to only displaying collections happening within the next leadtime days
data_description.value_template: Uses Home Assistant templating to format the state information of an entity. You can use 'value.date', 'value.daysTo', 'value.types
data_description.date_template: Uses Home Assistant templating to format the dates appearing within the more info popup information of an entity. e.g. 'value.date.strftime("%d.%m.%Y")'
data_description.add_days_to: Adds a 'daysTo' attribute to the source entity state containing the number of days to the next collection
data_description.event_index: Used to assign a sensor to a specific pickup date index. The next pickup date has event_index 0. Useful if you want to have dedicated sensors for next collection, second collection, third collection, ...
data_description.types: Used to filter waste types. The sensor will only display collections matching these waste types. You need to use the alias if you used alias in the sources configuration.
data_description.skip: If checked the sensor will not be created and all your config above will be ignored.
data_description.additional: If checked you will be prompted to add another sensor after saving this one.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Source
reconfigure.description: Configure your service provider. For details see the source documentation.

error.invalid_weekday: Invalid weekday. Please provide a valid weekday (MO, TU, WE, TH, FR, SA, SU).
error.invalid_count: Invalid count. Please provide a valid number.
error.invalid_weekdays: Invalid Weekday format please proivde one (MO, TU, WE, TH, FR, SA, SU) or a dictonary like MO: 1.
error.invalid_source: You did not select a source. Please select a valid source.
error.fetch_error: The source returned an invalid response: "{fetch_error_message}". Please check the provided arguments and try again.
error.fetch_empty: The source returned an empty response. Please check the provided arguments and try again.
error.invalid_template: The template is invalid. Please check the syntax and try again.
error.skip_additional: You cannot skip the current and add additional sensors at the same time.
error.name_exists: The sensor name already exists. Please choose a different name.
error.preset_selected: You cannot select a preset and provide custom values at the same time.
error.sensor_name_empty: The sensor name cannot be empty. Please provide a name.
error.dedicated_calendar_title_without_use_ded: You cannot provide a dedicated calendar title without enabling the dedicated calendar.

data_description.sensor_select: Select the sensor you want to modify. (select 'Add new sensor' to create a new sensor)
data_description.customize_select: Select the customization you want to modify. (or select a new customization to create a new one)
data_description.calendar_title: A more readable, or user-friendly, name for the waste calendar. If nothing is provided, the name returned by the source will be used.
data_description.separator: Used to join entries if the multiple values for a single day are returned by the source.
data_description.fetch_time: Representation of the time of day in 'HH:MM' that Home Assistant polls service provider for latest collection schedule.
data_description.random_fetch_time_offset: Randomly offsets the Fetch Time by up to x minutes. Can be used to distribute Home Assistant fetch commands over a longer time frame to avoid peak loads at service providers.
data_description.day_switch_time: Time of the day in 'HH:MM' that Home Assistant dismisses the current entry and moves to the next entry.

customize.title: Modify/Create Collection Type Customization ({index}/{total}): {type}
customize.description: Modify/Create Customization for "{type}". You can leave all fields empty to use the default values.

data_description.alias: The new name of the collection type. (only if you want to change it)
data_description.show: Uncheck to hide the collection type.
data_description.icon: The icon of the collection type. (only if you want to change it)
data_description.picture: The path to a picture for the collection type.
data_description.use_dedicated_calendar: Check if this collection type should have its own calendar entity.
data_description.dedicated_calendar_title: The title of the dedicated calendar entity.

sensor.title: Modify/Create Sensor "{sensor_number}"
sensor.description: Configure one sensor at a time.

data_description.details_format: Specifies the format used to display info in Home Assistant's more info pop-up. 'upcoming': shows a list of upcoming collections, 'appointment_types': shows a list of waste types and their next collection date, 'generic': provides all attributes as generic Python data types, 'hidden': hide attributes of upcoming collections
data_description.count: Limits Home Assistant's more info popup to displaying the next int collections
data_description.leadtime: Limits Home Assistant's more info popup to only displaying collections happening within the next leadtime days
data_description.value_template: Uses Home Assistant templating to format the state information of an entity. You can use 'value.date', 'value.daysTo', 'value.types
data_description.date_template: Uses Home Assistant templating to format the dates appearing within the more info popup information of an entity. e.g. 'value.date.strftime("%d.%m.%Y")'
data_description.add_days_to: Adds a 'daysTo' attribute to the source entity state containing the number of days to the next collection
data_description.event_index: Used to assign a sensor to a specific pickup date index. The next pickup date has event_index 0. Useful if you want to have dedicated sensors for next collection, second collection, third collection, ...
data_description.types: Used to filter waste types. The sensor will only display collections matching these waste types. You need to use the alias if you used alias in the sources configuration.
data_description.skip: If checked the sensor will not be created and all your config above will be ignored.
data_description.additional: If checked you will be prompted to add another sensor after saving this one.

error.time_format: Times must be given in HH:MM format.
error.invalid_template: The template is invalid. Please check the syntax and try again.
error.name_exists: The sensor name already exists. Please choose a different name.
error.preset_selected: You cannot select a preset and provide custom values at the same time.
error.sensor_name_empty: The sensor name cannot be empty. Please provide a name.
error.dedicated_calendar_title_without_use_ded: You cannot provide a dedicated calendar title without enabling the dedicated calendar.
